newsitem.title: USA: Read-Rite target of class action--laywers.
newsitem.headline: Read-Rite target of class action--laywers.

text.p: Two law firms said late Thursday that they had begun a class action in U.S. District Court for the Northern District of California on behalf of buyers of Read-Rite Corp securities.
The class action covers those who bought the company's securities from March 2, 1996, to June 19, 1996.

A joint statement from the law firms of Berger & Montague PC and Gold Bennett & Cera LLP said the action alleges Read-Rite and two of its officers and directors violated federal securities laws by issuing false and misleading statements and omitting material facts about the company's products, operations and financial performance.

The statement said the market price of Read-Rite stock was artificially inflated because of this, going from as high as $26.875 a share during the period covered by the class action to as low as $12.625 a share afterward.
Calls to Read-Rite's offices in Fremont, California, Thursday evening were not immediately returned.
